meanings.definition: To tell someone about something that happened
meanings.sent1: She will recount the exciting adventure to her friends.
meanings.sent2: I will recount the story of our family vacation.
meanings.sent3: He loves to recount his funny mishaps in a dramatic way.
meanings.sent4: The old man would recount tales of his youth like a seasoned bard.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to recount the historical event with passion.

meanings.sent1: Please recount the money to ensure it is correct.
meanings.sent2: I had to recount the votes to confirm the winner.
meanings.sent3: The child decided to recount the candies in the jar for fun.
meanings.sent4: The scientist had to recount the cells under the microscope for accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The cashier had to recount the coins in the register at the end of the day.
